summary: With about 48,000 deaths in 2024, fentanyl continues to be the primary cause of overdose deaths in the United States. The Department of Homeland Security has various efforts to combat the trafficking of illicit fentanyl. For example, it inspects incoming travelers and shipments and conducts patrols along the border. We reviewed these efforts and found issues with how DHS assesses their effectiveness. For example, DHS...
title: Illicit Fentanyl: DHS Has Various Efforts to Combat Trafficking but Could Better Assess Effectiveness
